goal.ch:
This course explores major issues of qualitative research methods, including concepts, theoretical background, and its application in research design. By taking this course, you will have an opportunity to learn qualitative methodology that can help you design your research and interpret the collected data.

The primary goal of this course is to provide discussions and applications of research techniques to Qualitative Methodology.
goal.en:
This course explores major issues of qualitative research methods, including concepts, theoretical background, and its application in research design. textbook.ch:
CLASS TEXT
Lincoln, Y. S., ＆ Guba, E. G. (1985). Naturalistic Inquiry. Newbury Park, CA: Sage Publication. ISBN: 0-8039-2431-3 (Required).

Class sessions will include lecture and discussion. Your active participation and consistent preparation for class is essential for you to attain course objectives.

gradMethod.ch:
COURSE REQUIREMENTS
1. Student will be expected to come to class having read the assigned material before class.
2. Out-of-class assignments need to be completed on time.
3. Late assignments will not be accepted except in the case of documented emergency.
4. Attend every class possible and take complete responsibility for class material when attending is not possible.
5. Active participation is expected and essential to obtaining a good grade.

GRADING AND ASSIGNMENT
Your grade will be based on your performance in the following areas:

Class Assignment30％
Paper Presentation40％
Class Attendance30％
